intro: Ixora tenuis, commonly known as the slender flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, fragrant clusters of orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ixora tenuis thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
